pr_body: In the documentation, there is a typography mistake in the first line of the first paragraph. The spelling mistake of ``Integration`` was misspelled as ``itegration``

- Setup Github RocketChat App
- Added basic slash commands to fetch repository data
- Added Message Templates for different queries
- Added interactive message to fetch repository data

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70485812/172072144-cd79b036-4f46-4e8c-a813-ae0fefffc38f.mp4


- Review Pull Requests

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70485812/173692660-2ccedc51-0203-4657-9eec-cd890337702d.mp4

pr_title: [New] Oath2 With RC Apps Scheduler and WebHooks Integration
pr_body:
## Issues

-   #3 
-   #6 

## Proposed changes (including videos or screenshots)

### OAuth2 and RC Scheduler API

  - New OAuth2 Mechanism for GitHub Login
  - Using RC App Scheduler to Logout User after a week
  - [Documentation and files Changed for OAuth2 and Scheduler API](https://github.com/RocketChat/Apps.Github22/wiki/Authentication-using-RC-OAuth2-Module-and-RC-Apps-Scheduler)


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70485812/177431842-1b6ca67d-d6bb-49f4-aaa0-f8745d1a759d.mp4

###  Repository Subscriptions / WebHooks Integration 

- New WebHook Post Endpoint  ~ Receives post request from other sources 
- [New Documentation and File Changes for GitHub Subscriptions/Web Hooks Integration](https://github.com/RocketChat/Apps.Github22/wiki/GitHub-Event-Subscriptions)
- Added Repository subscription  to all events ( isses, pull_request, push, deployment_status, star) using `/github USERNAME/REPONAME subscribe`


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70485812/177525601-e227871e-be0d-401d-bcb8-266f6c59b908.mp4


- Unsubscribe  to all repository events ( issues, pull_request, push, deployment_status, star) using `/github USERNAME/REPONAME unsubscribe` 


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70485812/177524844-5324e4fd-bab0-459a-b3a7-9aec099ee7bf.mp4


- New Subscription  Modal  and add Subscription Feature 


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70485812/177526725-4ff198b4-3b5c-442c-aabb-6a0a56947913.mp4


- Delete Subscriptions 

 

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70485812/177527353-de838647-b8b3-4531-8540-7723f1d5fe66.mp4

- Updating and Using Same Hook for different rooms (Edge Case Handling)

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70485812/177528143-cdf5f667-c2fd-4a15-ada7-7776909cd411.mp4

- Deleting Non Required events from the same hook ( Edge Case Handling)

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70485812/177529002-4e0de75c-95cc-4709-80f2-b0e2ecdd3273.mp4

pr_title: [Feature] Create GitHub Issues from Rocket.Chat channels
pr_body:
## Issue(s) 

<!-- Link the issues being closed by or related to this PR. For example, you can use Closes #594 if this PR closes issue number 594 -->

closes #10 

## Acceptance Criteria fulfillment

<!-- This will contain the acceptance criterias required by the Pull Request in order to close the issue. This Section can be deleted if no acceptance criteriasd are provided -->

- [x] Add slash command to open a new issues modal with input fields required to create an issue
- [x] Send Authenticated request to GitHub API to create a new issue
- [x] Handle edge cases with non authenticated developers
- [x] Repository owners can Add Assignees and Labels to the issue.

## Proposed changes (including videos or screenshots)

- Users can type `/github new-issue` to display a modal which takes input needed to create a new issue.
- Notify users about created issue.
- Repository owners can add assignees and labels to the issue.
- Assignees and labels drop for users who dont have edit access to the repository.


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70485812/179430347-0d3af688-ecbc-4aa9-8ed9-5d1c821f123a.mp4



<!-- CHANGELOG -->
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the maintainers why we should accept this pull request.
  If it fixes a bug or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue below.
  This description will appear in the release notes if we accept the contribution.
-->

<!-- END CHANGELOG -->
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 934003938, 'comment_body': 'Instead of having 7 and 8.   Is it possible to have a better user experience of ....

a) logging in within the app settings session
b) from time to time, the app will ask the user to re-enter credential for security

The will gave a better "set and forget" experience to most users.   Casual users will never be bothered with logging in and logging out.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 31, 15, 35, 54, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Sing-Li', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 934027217, 'comment_body': "@Sing-Li We cannot have the login phase in the apps settings session because the app settings are only visible to the users which have `Application Access` given by the `Server Admin` so I don't think it will be convenient.

The logout feature will not be used by most users, its just there for convenience incase anyone wants to remove credentials from the server. The Login will be done by the user through the slash command, but they will only be prompted to login while using some feature which requires auth. Apart from that, using `RC Scheduler` we will automatically logout the user periodically and they will be sent a direct message by `GitHub App bot` to login again. It follows the similar workflow as you have mentioned in `b)`, the user does not even have to enter credentials, they will be logged in directly once the click on the `login` button as the token is regenerated by GitHub. This was suggested by @RonLek  to keep the system scalable and not store tokens forever in App Memory. I have added the reasoning behind it in [Wiki/Auth](https://github.com/RocketChat/Apps.Github22/wiki/Authentication-using-RC-OAuth2-Module-and-RC-Apps-Scheduler#logout-user-using-scheduler-api).
Let me know if I am missing something, maybe we can improve the login user experience in some way, we can discuss this in the upcoming the weekly meeting :sweat_smile:", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 31, 19, 7, 49, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'samad-yar-khan', 'type': 'User'}]

## Acceptance Criteria fulfillment

<!-- This will contain the acceptance criterias required by the Pull Request in order to close the issue. This Section can be deleted if no acceptance criterias are provided -->


- [x] Enable user to trigger a search modal using `/github search`.
- [x] Enable user to enter search queries and fetch relevant results.
- [x] User Should be able to view and select the relevant search results in a another search view modal. 
- [x] Users should be able to send selected search result in the desired room.
- [x] Add documentation to the wiki for the GitHub search mechanism and user-flow
- [x] Handle non authenticated users edge cases. (GitHub Search API requires OAuth Token)

## Proposed changes (including videos or screenshots)

- Added [Documentation](https://github.com/RocketChat/Apps.Github22/wiki/GitHub-Search) for GitHub Search Feature 
- Added GitHub Search Modal which allows users to search repository issues and pull request based on different filters.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70485812/180270074-7a29d6bb-40cf-4f8e-bd5f-2fe7ef0a2052.mp4

- Added Result Sharing functionality. Enabled user to send selected Pull Request or Issue to current room by clicking on `Share`. Users can visit the issue/pull request on GitHub by clicking on `GitHub` button.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70485812/180274575-2d3a1c16-ba7f-454d-bafa-6b29a4b0623f.mp4

- Added `View Changes` button, which will be added to all Pull Request Results. Users can click on `View Changes` and see more details of the PR, including code changes. ( This can be one of the major painkillers. This will be upgraded to a code editor with indentation depending on the [fuselage team PR]() )

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70485812/180278267-b0b2e4f5-5d59-4146-b075-e6f63af022d9.mp4




<!-- CHANGELOG -->
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the maintainers why we should accept this pull request.
  If it fixes a bug or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue below.
  This description will appear in the release notes if we accept the contribution.
-->

<!-- END CHANGELOG -->


## Further comments

- Some of the features like reviewing code changes of a PR has been integrated with this Pull Request Change Result to improve collaboration.

[{'comment_id': 934002444, 'comment_body': "Can we be more helpful in the most common cases failed PR merge ?

Because of the simplicity of the wrapping  (our UI is less than github.com's webapp)  we may want to do just as much or more in this case. ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 31, 15, 23, 44, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Sing-Li', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 934002690, 'comment_body': "don't understand your comment here

Either explain clearly what you mean, or totally remove the code.     It will *always* still be in Github history anyways.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 31, 15, 25, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Sing-Li', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 934024755, 'comment_body': '@Sing-Li  The most common reason for not being able to merge would be 1) merge conflicts or 2) if the user is not authorized to push code in the repo. And in both the cases the message is usually displayed in modal. Incase there are merge conflicts or any other reason for not automatically merging, then it will mention on `pullDetailsModal` that its not mergeable. We can try to add a feature to resolve merge conflicts but it will be not be as ideal as the one github due to AppsEngine and UIKit Restrictions.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 31, 18, 43, 58, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'samad-yar-khan', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 934024781, 'comment_body': 'I will update this code, its still WIP.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 31, 18, 44, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'samad-yar-khan', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_body:
<!-- This is a pull request template, you do not need to uncomment or remove the comments, they won't show up in the PR text. -->


  feat: New `MediumMultilineInput` and `LargeMultilineInput` Elements


- I have read the Contributing Guide - https://github.com/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat/blob/develop/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#contributing-to-rocketchat doc
- I have signed the CLA - https://cla-assistant.io/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat
- Lint and unit tests pass locally with my changes
- I have labeled the PR correctly with the related package
- I have run visual regression tests (if applicable)
- I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works (if applicable)
- I have added necessary documentation (if applicable)
- Any dependent changes have been merged and published in downstream modules

## Why Do We need this ?


- Larger Multiline Input Elements will open new possibilities for Rocket.Chat App Developers. 
- Larger input components can be used in future apps which include a Code Editing App where the developers pair program inside Rocket.Chat.
- Or a Journal App/Notes App where journal Entries or more extensive notes can be made in RC
- Or a Future GitLab integrations where a code Review and Edit feature will be desirable.
- Larger can even be used in the main chat input component to edit and send a larger message to the Rocket.Chat channel, which may not be possible with the current input component.  
- Our use case and motivation to add this component to fuselage was to enable users display and merge PRs right from RocketChat channels through the [GitHub App](https://github.com/RocketChat/Apps.Github22). **This will be an exclusive feature which is not available in any `GitHub x Messaging` app intigration.**
- We currently use the `SectionBlock` as the `InputBlock` is too small, but the `SectionBlock` looses the indentation. 
- https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70485812/179247571-7c9001e6-ba40-4edc-9030-e1307818a79b.mp4

- **A Larger Input component can help us take fix this as it preserves indentation. This would improve community collaboration over Rocket.Chat and push `Messaging x Developer Collaboration` to the limits**
- The Same component can also be extended to add new Issues to GitHub or A Rocket.Chat app which parses and display markdown. The possibilities can be endless.
- https://github.com/RocketChat/fuselage/discussions/744



## Proposed changes (including videos or screenshots)

- Added New `MediumMultilineInput` and `LargeMultilineInput` elements to [fuselage-ui-kit](https://github.com/RocketChat/fuselage/tree/develop/packages/fuselage-ui-kit).
- Added the new elements to the storybook.

- Input With Medium Multiline Plane Text Input

  - Banner

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70485812/178167410-3837a459-824c-4be3-b14f-93be3f66814f.mp4

   - Modal

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70485812/178167421-04e53647-4466-4408-8b45-55038c7885d2.mp4

- Input With Large Multiline Plane Text Input

  - Banner 

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70485812/178167501-4a9b1c3a-bff4-4d68-8283-43f3f0f72696.mp4


   - Modal

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70485812/178167504-5d57ea78-39f1-4ad9-a9c8-bf0f907f7a3a.mp4


<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the maintainers why we should accept this pull request.
  If it fixes a bug or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue below.
  This description will appear in the release notes if we accept the contribution.
-->

<!-- END CHANGELOG -->

## Issue(s)

<!-- Link the issues being closed by or related to this PR. For example, you can use Closes #594 if this PR closes issue number 594 -->

closes #765
